diagnosis_and_stage.description: Metastatic non–small cell lung cancer, adenocarcinoma

imaging.findings: Multiple bilateral pulmonary nodules; largest target lesion 28 mm right upper lobe

clinical_notes.author: Dr. Jordan Rivera
clinical_notes.text:
S: Mia Johnson seen in clinic for follow-up of Metastatic non-small cell lung cancer, adenocarcinoma, stage IV. Reports fatigue level 3/10, mild dyspnea on exertion. No fever, chest pain, or bleeding. 
O: ECOG 1. Vitals stable. Lungs clear. No focal neurologic deficits. Labs reviewed: Cr 1.2 mg/dL; Hgb 10.9 g/dL.
A: Metastatic non-small cell lung cancer, adenocarcinoma, on active treatment. 

COMPREHENSIVE GENOMIC PROFILING INDICATED:
- Stage IV disease with metastatic spread
- Adenocarcinoma histology
- No prior comprehensive NGS testing
- Strong family history of multiple cancers
- Genetic counseling completed with Dr. Sarah Chen, MS, CGC
- Informed consent obtained
- Results will guide targeted therapy selection

TEST ORDERED: Comprehensive Solid Tumor Panel (500 genes) (CPT 81455)
PRIOR TESTS: 1 (limited hotspot panel only)

MEDICAL NECESSITY DOCUMENTATION COMPLETE:
✓ Genetic counseling documentation
✓ Family history assessment
✓ Clinical indication documented
✓ Analytical and clinical validity discussed
✓ Insurance coverage requirements met
✓ Informed consent obtained

P: Proceed with comprehensive genomic profiling. Prior authorization submitted with complete supporting documentation. Results will guide targeted therapy selection per NCCN guidelines.

clinical_notes.author: Dr. Jordan Rivera
clinical_notes.text:
REASON FOR CONSULT: Metastatic non-small cell lung cancer, adenocarcinoma

CLINICAL SUMMARY: Mia Johnson presents with metastatic non-small cell lung cancer, adenocarcinoma, AJCC stage IV (T2aN1M1a). Performance status ECOG 1. Patient has strong family history of multiple cancers including lung, prostate, breast, and colon cancer.

MEDICAL NECESSITY FOR COMPREHENSIVE GENOMIC PROFILING:
- Patient has advanced/metastatic cancer (Stage IV)
- No prior comprehensive NGS testing on this tumor
- Strong family history suggests potential hereditary component
- Results will guide targeted therapy selection
- TMB/MSI status needed for immunotherapy consideration
- Patient meets NCCN guidelines for comprehensive genomic profiling

CLINICAL INDICATION:
- Stage IV non-small cell lung cancer
- Adenocarcinoma histology
- Metastatic disease present
- Performance status suitable for treatment
- No prior comprehensive genomic profiling
- Family history of multiple cancers

ASSESSMENT/PLAN:
1. Comprehensive tumor profiling (CPT 81455) - Comprehensive Solid Tumor Panel (500 genes)
2. Genetic counseling completed with Dr. Sarah Chen, MS, CGC
3. Informed consent obtained
4. Results will guide targeted therapy selection
5. Consider germline testing if suspicious variants identified

MEDICAL NECESSITY JUSTIFICATION:
- Results will directly impact treatment decisions
- Patient eligible for targeted therapies based on molecular profile
- TMB/MSI status critical for immunotherapy consideration
- Family history warrants comprehensive assessment
- Meets all insurance coverage criteria for advanced cancer

Pathology confirms histology consistent with diagnosis. All documentation requirements met for prior authorization.

clinical_notes.author: Dept. of Pathology
clinical_notes.text:
Specimen: Excisional biopsy from Lung, unspecified.
Microscopic Description: Invasive carcinoma with G3. Tumor measures 60 mm. Lymphovascular invasion: Present. Margins: Positive.
Lymph nodes examined: 6, positive: 4. Tumor cellularity estimated at 30%.

clinical_notes.author: GenomeDx Clinical
clinical_notes.text:
Comprehensive genomic profiling identified: EGFR c.2573T>G (p.L858R), TP53 c.743G>A (p.R248Q). 
Summary metrics: TMB 10 mut/Mb; MSI Stable; PD-L1 CPS 55.
Interpretation: Detected alterations may confer sensitivity to FDA-labeled targeted therapies or clinical trials. See variant-level evidence annotations. Clinical correlation recommended.

clinical_notes.author: Dr. Sarah Chen, MS, CGC
clinical_notes.text:
COMPREHENSIVE GENETIC COUNSELING SESSION - COMPLETED

PATIENT: Mia Johnson (MRN: MRN542417)
DIAGNOSIS: Metastatic non-small cell lung cancer, adenocarcinoma, Stage IV
TEST REQUESTED: Comprehensive Solid Tumor Panel (500 genes) - CPT 81455

FAMILY HISTORY ASSESSMENT:
- Mother: Lung cancer diagnosed at age 58, deceased 2018
- Father: Prostate cancer diagnosed at age 65, alive, treated with radical prostatectomy
- Maternal aunt: Breast cancer diagnosed at age 52, alive, treated with lumpectomy + chemotherapy
- Paternal uncle: Colon cancer diagnosed at age 60, deceased 2015

RISK ASSESSMENT:
- Strong family history of multiple cancer types suggests potential hereditary cancer syndrome
- Patient's early-onset lung cancer (age 57) with family history warrants comprehensive genomic profiling
- Clinical utility: Results may guide targeted therapy selection and identify germline risk factors

COUNSELING COMPONENTS COMPLETED:
✓ Purpose and scope of testing explained
✓ Genes/panel scope discussed (500 genes including actionable targets)
✓ Privacy and data use policies reviewed
✓ Secondary findings policy explained
✓ Re-contact policy discussed
✓ Clinical utility of results explained
✓ Analytical validity discussed (99.9% sensitivity, 99.5% specificity)
✓ Clinical validity discussed (FDA-approved companion diagnostics)
✓ Insurance coverage and prior authorization process explained
✓ Alternative testing options discussed
✓ Limitations of testing explained
✓ Follow-up plan established

INFORMED CONSENT:
- Patient demonstrates understanding of test purpose and limitations
- Consent signed and witnessed
- Copy provided to patient

CLINICAL RECOMMENDATION:
- Proceed with comprehensive genomic profiling
- Results will be disclosed by ordering physician
- Genetic counselor available for follow-up questions
- Consider germline testing if suspicious variants identified

DOCUMENTATION: Complete family history documented, risk assessment completed, informed consent obtained. All requirements for insurance coverage met.

clinical_notes.author: Prior Auth Coordinator
clinical_notes.text:
PA PA7350753 submitted for Comprehensive Solid Tumor Panel (500 genes) (CPT 81455) to Medicare (Medicare Advantage HMO).
Included attachments: pathology synoptic, molecular order, clinic note. Coverage rationale cites NCD 90.2 and plan policy; patient has advanced disease and no prior comprehensive NGS on same primary tumor = criteria met.
Awaiting response; if pended, will upload additional evidence (progress note, imaging).

clinical_notes.text:

Impression: Findings compatible with metastatic disease. Recommend correlation with clinical status and tumor kinetics.

clinical_notes.text:

clinical_notes.author: Genetic Counselor, MS, CGC
clinical_notes.text:
Pre-test counseling conducted. Discussed benefits/limitations of tumor profiling and potential incidental/secondary findings. Consent elements reviewed: purpose/scope, genes/panel scope, privacy/data use, secondary findings, re-contact policy. Patient signed consent; copy filed.
Family history notable for: Mother - Breast cancer @ 52, Maternal aunt - Ovarian cancer @ 58.
Plan: Disclose results with oncology; discuss implications for relatives if germline risk suspected.

clinical_notes.author: Dr. Morgan Miller
clinical_notes.text:
S: Sophia Lewis seen in clinic for follow-up of Newly diagnosed AML, stage NA. Reports fatigue level 3/10, mild dyspnea on exertion. No fever, chest pain, or bleeding. 
O: ECOG 3. Vitals stable. Lungs clear. No focal neurologic deficits. Labs reviewed: Cr 0.75 mg/dL; Hgb 11.9 g/dL.
A: Newly diagnosed AML, on active treatment. Molecular profiling ordered: Heme Malignancy 54-gene (CPT 81450). Noted prior tests count: 0.
P: Proceed with molecular test. If actionable alterations present, will consider targeted therapy per guidelines. Will submit prior authorization today with supporting documents.

clinical_notes.author: Dr. Morgan Miller
clinical_notes.text:
Reason for consult: Newly diagnosed AML. Summary: Sophia Lewis presents with Newly diagnosed AML. AJCC stage NA. Performance status ECOG 3. Family history reviewed; genetic counseling offered.
Assessment/Plan: Comprehensive tumor profiling to assess for targetable alterations and to estimate TMB/MSI. Consent obtained for genetic testing. Pathology confirms histology consistent with diagnosis.

clinical_notes.author: Dept. of Pathology
clinical_notes.text:
Specimen: Core needle biopsy from Bone marrow.
Microscopic Description: Invasive carcinoma with G3. Tumor measures 22 mm. Lymphovascular invasion: Absent. Margins: Not applicable.
Lymph nodes examined: 20, positive: 1. Tumor cellularity estimated at 50%.

clinical_notes.author: GenomeDx Clinical
clinical_notes.text:
Comprehensive genomic profiling identified: FLT3 Internal tandem duplication, NPM1 c.860_863dup (p.W288fs). 
Summary metrics: TMB NA mut/Mb; MSI NA.
Interpretation: Detected alterations may confer sensitivity to FDA-labeled targeted therapies or clinical trials. See variant-level evidence annotations. Clinical correlation recommended.

clinical_notes.author: Genetic Counselor, MS, CGC
clinical_notes.text:
Pre-test counseling conducted. Discussed benefits/limitations of tumor profiling and potential incidental/secondary findings. Consent elements reviewed: purpose/scope, genes/panel scope, privacy/data use, secondary findings, re-contact policy. Patient signed consent; copy filed.
Family history notable for: non-contributory.
Plan: Disclose results with oncology; discuss implications for relatives if germline risk suspected.

clinical_notes.author: Prior Auth Coordinator
clinical_notes.text:
PA PA7960328 submitted for Heme Malignancy 54-gene (CPT 81450) to UnitedHealthcare (Commercial PPO).
Included attachments: pathology synoptic, molecular order, clinic note. Coverage rationale cites NCD 90.2 and plan policy; patient has advanced disease and no prior comprehensive NGS on same primary tumor = criteria met.
Awaiting response; if pended, will upload additional evidence (progress note, imaging).

clinical_notes.author: Radiology Attending, MD
clinical_notes.text:
CT CAP: Multiple bilateral pulmonary nodules; largest target lesion 28 mm right upper lobe.
Impression: Findings compatible with metastatic disease. Recommend correlation with clinical status and tumor kinetics.
